text:
I just compiled Apache/2.2.2 and it runs fine. But when I try to run
htcacheclean it only shows the help screen 

htcacheclean -- program for cleaning the disk cache.
Usage: htcacheclean [-Dvtrn] -pPATH -lLIMIT
       htcacheclean [-nti] -dINTERVAL -pPATH -lLIMIT

and so on without doing anything. I tried

./htcacheclean -d15 -p/home/www/ProxyCache
./htcacheclean -tn -p/home/www/ProxyCache
./htcacheclean -Dtn -p"/home/www/ProxyCache"

and more ...
 
All other support programs are running fine.
creator: kaplan@ma.tum.de
rpluem@apache.org
text: You forgot to specify the parameter -l which is mandatory.

(In reply to comment #1)
> You forgot to specify the parameter -l which is mandatory.

Thanks a lot. That does the trick. 
It should be documented in the man page that this
parameter is mandatory. In my opinion the parameter 
-t would for example make sense without -l.
creator: kaplan@ma.tum.de
